Note that the income can be positive, zero or negative.Igor and Zhenya placed the papers in a row and decided to take turns making moves. You are given a sequence of $n$ numbers ($n \le 4000$), where each number represents the income of a company for a specific time period.  

Two players take turns selecting numbers from opposite ends of the sequence. 

* On the first turn, the first player can choose to take 1 or 2 numbers from the left end.
* On subsequent turns, a player can take $k+1$ numbers from their side if the opponent took exactly $k$ numbers on the previous turn.
* Players cannot skip their turns.

The game ends when there are no numbers left in the sequence or a player cannot make a move.

Determine the difference between the sum of incomes of the numbers taken by the first player and the sum of incomes of the numbers taken by the second player, assuming both players play optimally. The first player aims to maximize this difference, while the second player aims to minimize it.

Two players take turns removing items from opposite ends of a line.  A player can remove 1 or 2 items on their first turn, and on subsequent turns, they can remove a number of items equal to one more than the number of items the opponent removed on their previous turn.  The game ends when there are no more items.  Determine the difference in the total value of the items each player takes, assuming both players play optimally.
